headline: Tariffs are here to stay — and US manufacturing can't keep up, former Coach CEO says
summary: Former Coach CEO Lew Frankfort isn't betting on tariffs to bring US manufacturing back.

content.title: Tariffs are here to stay — and US manufacturing can't keep up, former Coach CEO says
content.summary: Former Coach CEO Lew Frankfort isn't betting on tariffs to bring US manufacturing back.

headline: Why Coach's former CEO says America's future depends on immigrants.
summary: Opening Bid Unfiltered is available on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, YouTube, or wherever you get your podcasts. Before it was known as Tapestry (TPR) and an owner of the Coach and Kate Spade Brands, Coach was just Coach — maker of handbags and accessories that dominated mall racks. But like with every retailer in business for decades, Coach has stories to tell. Yahoo Finance Executive Editor Brian Sozzi sits on the Opening Bid Unfiltered podcast with former longtime Coach CEO Lew Frankfort. Frankfort is out with a new memoir called "Bag Man: The Story Behind the Improbable Rise of Coach." The book takes readers inside the history of the accessories maker founded in New York City in 1941. Frankfurt joined the company in 1979 with no background in the fashion industry. By 1985, he was the president of Coach, CEO by 1995, and then led the company’s IPO on the New York Stock Exchange in 2000. He departed Coach as CEO in January 2014, but has stayed close to the company and the broader retail industry. Frankfort shares his journey through the C-suite and the lessons he learned along the way. Listen on your favorite podcast platform or watch on our website for full episodes of Opening Bid Unfiltered. Yahoo Finance's Opening Bid Unfiltered is produced by Langston Sessoms.

headline: How a former Coach CEO would fix retail right now
summary: Opening Bid Unfiltered is available on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, YouTube, or wherever you get your podcasts. In this clip from Opening Bid Unfiltered, former Coach CEO Lew Frankfort explains how he would approach running a global retailer today. He tells Brian Sozzi that careful planning and mindfulness are essential when managing costs, suppliers, and shifting consumer habits. Frankfort emphasizes that the best leaders think long term and protect both the brand and the people behind it. Listen on your favorite podcast platform or watch on our website for full episodes of Opening Bid Unfiltered. This post was written by Langston Sessoms, producer for Opening Bid Unfiltered.
